item.title: Helldivers 2 Patch Notes Resolve More Hard Crashes, Buff New Dust Devil Items
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

As a game that's constantly evolving, Helldivers 2 is no stranger to hotfixes and patches. In fact, a new update has just gone live, and it is designed to quickly address several issues that have cropped up in the game since the start of the Into the Unjust event in the game. This new patch focuses primarily on game-breaking issues causing hard crashes, as well as buffs to the new gear introduced in the Dust Devils warbond.

For general fixes, players can expect several problems to be addressed. Developer Arrowhead says that the crashes related to there being too many particle effects, Automaton missions, and a bug with a seeking missile have been resolved with this patch. Other tweaks include the extraction shuttle landing more safely for players, hive world tunnels should no longer be darker than intended if you're using lower graphics settings, and the excessive light emitted by the Hellpad has also been toned down.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Helldivers 2 - Dust Devils Warbond Gameplay Trailer

When it comes to weapons and stratagems, there have also been a few issues here. The LIFT-182 Warp Pack tended to make players get stuck midair, and there were also instances of the game crashing when a player aborted a mission while wielding a turret or driving a vehicle. These should all be fixed here, and it should also be safe to equip the Halo ODST MA5C assault rifle when you're on the bridge of your flagship.

For the buffs, Arrowhead is reducing the cooldown on the MS-11 Solo Silo and giving the S-11 Speargun a quicker reload. The silo stratagem cooldown will now drop from 210 seconds to 180 seconds, while the Speargun reload time has been cut by an entire second to just 2.5 seconds. A larger patch released earlier this week also killed several bugs, allowing players more freedom so that they could also go on a bug hunt. If you're one of them, just be prepared to pack a few nukes in case you run into a Hive Lord.

Helldivers 2 is also available for Xbox Series X|S now, and so far, that has seen plenty of fresh recruits join the fight to bring managed democracy to distant planets.

Helldiver 2 Hotfix 01.004.001

MS-11 Solo Silo

  • Cooldown changed from 210 seconds to 180 seconds

S-11 Speargun

  • Decreased reload duration from 3.5 to 2.5 seconds

General fixes

  • Fixed a crash that can happen when too many particle effects are spawned
  • Fixed a crash when Helldivers are in Hellpods after being reinforced
  • Fixed an issue where light emitted by the Hellpad could become excessively bright under certain conditions
  • General crash fix occurring during Automaton missions
  • Fixed issue in which hive world tunnels would become darker than intended in certain circumstances when a user is using lower graphics settings
  • Fixed a crash that could occur if the target of a seeking missile gets deleted before impact
  • The extraction shuttle will land in a more safe and sound manner

Weapons & Stratagem fixes

  • Fixed the LIFT-182 Warp Pack getting stuck suspended in the air or crashing
  • Fixed a rare crash caused by multiple players having the MA5C AR equipped on the Super Destroyer
  • Fixed Displacements Backpack VFX issues whilst aiming down sights
  • Fixed a rare crash which could occur when aborting a mission while a player was wielding a turret or driving a vehicle

item.title: Amazon Prime Members Get These 11 Free Games In September
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Amazon has revealed the PC games that'll be coming to Prime Gaming in September, and this month, you can grab one of the best strategy games ever made, a story-driven dungeon-crawler, and a cute puzzle-platformer.

This is a small month overall, but if there's one game that can easily consume dozens of hours, it's Into the Breach. Best described as Pacific Rim meets chess--and also one of the rare games to get a 10/10 score on GameSpot--the turn-based tactics adventure sees you command several mechs in battle against massive monsters. You'll have to carefully measure every action you take as you aim to prevent the extinction of humanity, while also being forced to make hard choices along the way. There's a time-travel element as well, so if things get too tough, you can always rewind time and start from the beginning in a new timeline.

For a grander tactical experience, Sid Meier's Civilization 4 will scratch your itch for 4X strategy as you take your chosen nation from rags to riches, Afterimage is a hand-drawn 2D action adventure that emphasizes fast-paced combat, and Residual will see you explore a procedurally generated alien world.

As a reminder, all of the free games that you claim through Prime Gaming are yours to keep forever, even if your subscription expires. If you aren't a member, you can sign up for Amazon Prime for as little as one month to take advantage of the subscription and the freebies offered through it.

Prime Gaming free games for September 2025

Now available

  • Dungeons & Dragons: Ravenloft Series (GOG Code)
  • Into The Breach (Epic Games Store)
  • Sid Meier's Civilization 4: The Complete Edition (GOG Code)

September 11

  • Afterimage (Amazon Games App)
  • Spelljammer: Pirates of Realmspace (GOG Code)
  • Tower of Time (GOG Code)
  • Subterrain: Mines of Titan [(Amazon Games App)

September 18

  • Residual (GOG Code)
  • Fate: The Cursed King (GOG Code)

September 25

  • Mystical Riddles: Ghostly Park Collector's Edition (Legacy Games Code)
  • Pixel Cafe (Amazon Games App)

Prime subscribers will also be able to play the following games in August via the Prime Gaming Luna channel:

  • Jackbox Party Pack 10
  • Control: Ultimate Edition
  • Garfield Kart: Furious Racing
  • MotoGP 24
  • Garfield Lasagna Party
  • The Expanse: A Telltale Series Deluxe Edition
  • SteamWorld Heist: Ultimate Edition
  • Nobody Saves The World Complete
  • SteamWorld Quest: Hand of Gilgamech
  • SteamWorld Dig 2
  • The Mummy Demastered
  • The Adventure Pals
  • River City Girls
  • Fortnite OG
  • Fortnite Ballistic
  • Lego Fortnite Brick Life
  • Fortnite Battle Royale
  • Fortnite Festival
  • Lego Fortnite Odyssey
  • Rocket Racing
  • Fortnite
  • Trackmania Starter Access
  • Fallout New Vegas: Ultimate Edition
  • Fallout 3: Game of the Year Edition
  • Rainbow Six Siege

item.title: New EA College Basketball Game Benched, As 2K Sports College Hoops Moves Forward - Report
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

There might not be a new EA Sports college basketball game after all. A new report states that the company is notifying universities and conferences that it won't be moving forward with plans for the sports title, as apparently some schools have accepted offers for a 2K Sports College Hoops proposal.

Extra Points reports that EA Sports vice president of commercial partnerships and licensing Sean O'Brien has sent out a letter stating that the company "is disappointed that we all couldn't find an acceptable path forward." In June, EA announced the return of NCAA Basketball, 16 years after the previous entry in the series. O'Brien noted 2K Sports as a reason why the revival isn't happening.

"Given there are some schools choosing to accept the 2K Sports proposal for inclusion in NBA 2K, the offer to be included in a college basketball video game will unfortunately have to be rescinded," O'Brien wrote. The Athletic reported that EA's offer required exclusive rights and was recommended by the Collegiate Licensing Company because it encompassed 730 teams (for men and women).

There has been conflicting info about whether 2K will add college teams to the NBA 2K franchise or make a separate game--or possibly start with DLC and then adapt. In July, a report surfaced that noted 2K Sports was planning a standalone College Hoops 2K title. Other details included the company reaching out to major schools like Michigan St. and UCLA, with plans to feature 100 men's and women's programs. Meanwhile, EA CEO Andrew Wilson previously proclaimed he wanted "all 350 programs" for its college basketball game.

EA last released a college basketball game with NCAA Basketball 10 in 2009, while College Hoops 2K8 was the last entry in that series in 2007.

Just last week, O'Brien noted that EA's college basketball game was nowhere near release. The executive also said the company was "up for the challenge" while also acknowledging the project as a "daunting task."

item.title: Hollow Knight: Silksong Is Already Discounted, But Only For These Cool Kids
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Hollow Knight: Silksong is finally out, and with the entire internet talking about Team Cherry's long-in-development metroidvania, you might be feeling some FOMO about it. The good news is that the game is relatively cheap to purchase, and if you're looking to save a few extra bucks, you can score a discount on the Steam version and some free games if you happen to be a Humble Choice subscriber. Right now, you can get the game at a 15% discount, dropping the price of Silksong from $20 to $17. Humble has temporarily sold out of keys at the moment, but a restock is on the way.

This deal is one of the perks that Humble Choice subscribers get with their monthly membership, which costs $15 a month. Alongside new PC games that are refreshed every month, you also get access to the Humble Vault--an additional rotating library of games. The best thing about the membership is that the PC games you claim are yours to keep forever, even if you decide to cancel your membership. This month is also pretty good, as you can pick up WWE 2K25, Destiny 2: Legacy Collection, The Plucky Squire, Return to Monkey Island, and more.

If you bought Silksong and didn't get your Steam key before it sold out, Humble is offering DRM-free keys as an alternative. Speaking of DRM-free keys, you can get Silksong at its regular price of $20 through GOG. The benefit here is that you're getting a DRM-free version of the game, which means the license for it will never be revoked and it can play without needing to start through a launcher. You can also easily load it onto a mobile gaming PC like an Asus ROG Ally and keep on playing, even when you're in an internet dead zone.

While Silksong is out, you might have to wait a little longer to play it as various digital storefronts are experiencing a few issues. Steam, the Nintendo eShop, the PlayStation Network, and Xbox appear to be buckling under the strain of excited players, and on Steam alone, the game reached more than 100,000 concurrent players in under an hour. If the Nintendo eShop is still down for you, Amazon is selling digital Silksong keys for Switch.

item.title: Silksong Has A Huge Start On Steam
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Hollow Knight: Silksong is finally available, and it's putting up huge numbers on Steam. The game blasted off today with 5,000 concurrent players in the first five minutes, growing to 50,000 within 30 minutes and 100,000 after the first 45 minutes of availability. It's now exceeded 478,000 concurrent players.

Silksong is currently the No. 3 most-played game on Steam right now. The game is putting up these massive figures despite numerous and serious issues on Steam that are preventing people from accessing the store, let alone buying and playing the game.

The 2017 original Hollow Knight, meanwhile, capped out at a peak concurrent-player record of 72,916--a record that was, in fact, achieved just recently on September 3. The game's player numbers no doubt spiked due to interest in the sequel.

Silksong's Steam numbers are expected to keep climbing. Historical data shows that Steam games tend to spike on weekends in terms of popularity when people generally have more free time.

Silksong is also available for console, but the same kind of player data is not available on PS5, Xbox Series X|S, or Switch 2. On Xbox and PC, the game is also available via Game Pass, so any sales data for those platforms wouldn't necessarily tell the whole story. For what it's worth, Silksong's rollout on console platforms also ran into a number of issues.

The original Hollow Knight sold more than 15 million copies.

In other Silksong news, the game has Twitch Drops available for a Hornet badge. Hornet is the playable character in Team Cherry's long-awaited sequel.

Silksong took years to come out, but it wasn't because the game was stuck in development hell or anything like that, the developers said. Simply put, the enormous success of the first game gave the small team the time to develop the sequel at their own pace. Also adding to the lengthy development schedule was how Silksong actually began as an expansion to Hollow Knight before shifting to a standalone release.
